title: How to Draw the Egyptian Pyramids

steps.headline: Start by drawing a pyramid.
Sketch large wavy lines to illustrate the sand dunes surrounding it.
Add a small circle on top of the pyramid for the sun.
steps.description: Add some palm trees too. Sketch the trees with a small burst and then a thin rectangle line below the burst. Remember it doesn’t have to be perfect

steps.headline: Outline your drawing by inking over your sketched lines using a pen or marker.
steps.description: Erase your penciled marks to clean up your drawing.

steps.headline: Color it in and you’re done.
steps.description: Use colors such as an orange, yellow/green, mud green, teal, sky blue and yellow.

text:
Start by drawing a pyramid. Create a triangle but curve its lower part and then add an angled line on its center. Make sure you also draw the pyramid at the left part of your paper. Draw a triangle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Shape-Step-1-7.jpg/v4-460px-Shape-Step-1-7.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/6b/Shape-Step-1-7.jpg/aid1829390-v4-600px-Shape-Step-1-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":"600","bigHeight":"400","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Draw a guideline from the tip tilted to the right. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Guide-Step-2.jpg/v4-460px-Guide-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/f/ff/Guide-Step-2.jpg/aid1829390-v4-601px-Guide-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"601","bigHeight":"400","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Connect the two remaining corners to the lower end of the guideline. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Base-Step-3.jpg/v4-460px-Base-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b4/Base-Step-3.jpg/aid1829390-v4-600px-Base-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":"600","bigHeight":"401","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Having erased the excess lines you get a generic pyramid, let's make it Egyptian. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Outline-Step-4-20.jpg/v4-460px-Outline-Step-4-20.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/a/a8/Outline-Step-4-20.jpg/aid1829390-v4-600px-Outline-Step-4-20.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":"600","bigHeight":"401","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Draw this pattern in different places in the pyramid, it will make it look like it's made of bricks. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Patern-Step-5.jpg/v4-460px-Patern-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/2a/Patern-Step-5.jpg/aid1829390-v4-600px-Patern-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":"600","bigHeight":"401","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use yellow and brown to make it look real. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Paint-Step-6-7.jpg/v4-460px-Paint-Step-6-7.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/c/ca/Paint-Step-6-7.jpg/aid1829390-v4-601px-Paint-Step-6-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":"601","bigHeight":"401","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Sketch large wavy lines to illustrate the sand dunes surrounding it. Add a small circle on top of the pyramid for the sun. Add some palm trees too. Sketch the trees with a small burst and then a thin rectangle line below the burst. Remember it doesn’t have to be perfect Outline your drawing by inking over your sketched lines using a pen or marker. Erase your penciled marks to clean up your drawing. Color it in and you’re done. Use colors such as an orange, yellow/green, mud green, teal, sky blue and yellow.
